items.title: Thousands of Palestinians flee as Israeli bombs rain down on Gaza City
items.standfirst: At least 91 were killed in the city on Tuesday as Israel intensifies its offensive, forcing thousands to flee.
items.content: At least 91 were killed in the city on Tuesday as Israel intensifies its offensive, forcing thousands to flee.

items.title: Israel launches ground offensive in Gaza City
items.standfirst: Thousands of Palestinians fled from Gaza City after Israel launched a ground offensive. It comes as a new report today from an independent United Nations commission concluded Israel is committing genocide. NBC News’ Matt Bradley reports.
items.content: Thousands of Palestinians fled from Gaza City after Israel launched a ground offensive. It comes as a new report today from an independent United Nations commission concluded Israel is committing genocide. NBC News’ Matt Bradley reports.

items.title: Ex-Israeli PM Naftali Bennett on Gaza City offensive, U.N. commission genocide report and more
items.standfirst: As Israel launches a ground offensive to take Gaza City, a U.N. commission concluded Tuesday that the country is committing genocide in the Palestinian territory. Israel has dismissed the claims. Former Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett joins "The Takeout" to discuss the operation and to address the report.
items.content: As Israel launches a ground offensive to take Gaza City, a U.N. commission concluded Tuesday that the country is committing genocide in the Palestinian territory. Israel has dismissed the claims. Former Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett joins "The Takeout" to discuss the operation and to address the report.

items.title: Israel Committing Genocide in Gaza Says UN Commission
items.standfirst: Israel rejects UN Commission finding that it is committing genocide in Gaza.
items.content: Israel rejects UN Commission finding that it is committing genocide in Gaza.

items.title: Israel launches ground offensive deep inside Gaza City
items.standfirst: IDF says advance aims to ‘dismantle Hamas’s grip’ as UN report says Israel has committed genocide in territoryIsrael unleashed its long-threatened ground offensive in Gaza City on Tuesday, sending tanks and remote-controlled armoured cars packed with explosives into its streets, in defiance of international criticism and the findings of a UN commission that it was committing genocide in the Palestinian territory.“Gaza is burning. The IDF is striking terror infrastructure with an iron fist,” Israel’s defence minister, Israel Katz, wrote on X as the attack was launched in the early hours of the morning, adding: “We will not relent until the mission is completed.” Continue reading...
items.content: IDF says advance aims to ‘dismantle Hamas’s grip’ as UN report says Israel has committed genocide in territoryIsrael unleashed its long-threatened ground offensive in Gaza City on Tuesday, sending tanks and remote-controlled armoured cars packed with explosives into its streets, in defiance of international criticism and the findings of a UN commission that it was committing genocide in the Palestinian territory.“Gaza is burning. The IDF is striking terror infrastructure with an iron fist,” Israel’s defence minister, Israel Katz, wrote on X as the attack was launched in the early hours of the morning, adding: “We will not relent until the mission is completed.” Continue reading...

items.title: Israel has committed genocide in Gaza, says UN commission of inquiry
items.standfirst: Report cites scale of killings and aid blockages, and calls on member countries to punish those responsibleA UN commission has found that Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, citing tens of thousands of civilian deaths and massive destruction, and has called on member countries to punish those responsible for it.The United Nations independent international commission of inquiry (COI), which does not speak on behalf of the UN, found that “genocide is occurring in Gaza and is continuing to occur”, said its head, Navi Pillay. Continue reading...
items.content: Report cites scale of killings and aid blockages, and calls on member countries to punish those responsibleA UN commission has found that Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, citing tens of thousands of civilian deaths and massive destruction, and has called on member countries to punish those responsible for it.The United Nations independent international commission of inquiry (COI), which does not speak on behalf of the UN, found that “genocide is occurring in Gaza and is continuing to occur”, said its head, Navi Pillay. Continue reading...

items.title: 'The bombing has been insane': Palestinians scramble to flee Israeli assault on Gaza City
items.standfirst: Palestinians tell the BBC whole residential blocks have been levelled as the Israeli army ramps up its offensive in the city.
items.content: Palestinians tell the BBC whole residential blocks have been levelled as the Israeli army ramps up its offensive in the city.

items.title: United Nations commission of inquiry accuses Israel of genocide in Gaza
items.standfirst: A team of independent experts commissioned by the United Nations' Human Rights Council has concluded that Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, issuing a report Tuesday that calls on the international community to end the genocide and take steps to punish those responsible for it.
items.content: A team of independent experts commissioned by the United Nations' Human Rights Council has concluded that Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, issuing a report Tuesday that calls on the international community to end the genocide and take steps to punish those responsible for it.

items.title: A U.N. inquiry accuses Israel of genocide in Gaza, joining a rising chorus
items.standfirst: The report issued Tuesday by experts commissioned by the United Nations' Human Rights Council calls on the international community to end the genocide and take steps to punish those responsible.
items.content: The report issued Tuesday by experts commissioned by the United Nations' Human Rights Council calls on the international community to end the genocide and take steps to punish those responsible.(Image credit: Yousef Al Zanoun)

items.title: Israel has committed genocide in Gaza, UN commission of inquiry says
items.standfirst: The panel finds that four of the five genocidal acts defined under international law have been carried out against Palestinians during the war.
items.content: The panel finds that four of the five genocidal acts defined under international law have been carried out against Palestinians during the war.

items.title: Bowen: UN commission report on genocide is blunt indictment of Israel's actions in Gaza
items.standfirst: A new report accuses Israel of committing genocide in Gaza, in "the strongest and most authoritative UN finding to date".
items.content: A new report accuses Israel of committing genocide in Gaza, in "the strongest and most authoritative UN finding to date".

items.title: UN Commission says Israel is committing genocide in Gaza
items.standfirst: Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, according to a commission established by the United Nations.
items.content: Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, according to a commission established by the United Nations.

ai_summary: Israel launched a ground offensive in Gaza City, prompting thousands to flee the area.
A UN commission concluded Israel is committing genocide in the Palestinian territory.

Israel's defense minister stated the offensive aims to dismantle Hamas's grip on Gaza.
The UN report and the offensive have drawn international criticism and condemnation.

items.title: Charlie Kirk killing suspect charged with aggravated murder by Utah prosecutors
items.standfirst: Tyler Robinson charged with aggravated murder, felony discharge of a firearm and witness tampering and could face the death penaltyUtah state prosecutors on Tuesday charged Tyler Robinson, the man accused of fatally shooting the far right activist Charlie Kirk, with aggravated murder – and they say they intend to pursue the death penalty against the 22-year-old if he is convicted.Jeff Gray, the top prosecutor in Utah county, where Kirk was fatally shot on 10 September, said Robinson also ordered his roommate to delete incriminating text messages and stay silent if police questioned him in the aftermath of the Turning Point USA executive director’s killing. Continue reading...
items.content: Tyler Robinson charged with aggravated murder, felony discharge of a firearm and witness tampering and could face the death penaltyUtah state prosecutors on Tuesday charged Tyler Robinson, the man accused of fatally shooting the far right activist Charlie Kirk, with aggravated murder – and they say they intend to pursue the death penalty against the 22-year-old if he is convicted.Jeff Gray, the top prosecutor in Utah county, where Kirk was fatally shot on 10 September, said Robinson also ordered his roommate to delete incriminating text messages and stay silent if police questioned him in the aftermath of the Turning Point USA executive director’s killing. Continue reading...

items.content: Court documents show the suspect's roommate found a note in their apartment that read, "I had the opportunity to take out Charlie Kirk and I'm going to take it."

items.title: Utah prosecutors’ evidence indicates suspected motives of Charlie Kirk’s alleged shooter
items.standfirst: Tyler Robinson is quoted talking to his partner about having enough of the far-right activist’s ‘hatred’ in textsEvidence put forth by Utah prosecutors Tuesday offered the clearest indication yet of what they suspect motivated Tyler Robinson to kill far-right provocateur Charlie Kirk.In seized texts reproduced by prosecutors as they charged the 22-year-old with capital murder and other crimes after his arrest, Robinson is quoted talking to his partner – whom they described as “transitioning genders” – about having enough of Kirk’s “hatred”. Continue reading...
items.content: Tyler Robinson is quoted talking to his partner about having enough of the far-right activist’s ‘hatred’ in textsEvidence put forth by Utah prosecutors Tuesday offered the clearest indication yet of what they suspect motivated Tyler Robinson to kill far-right provocateur Charlie Kirk.In seized texts reproduced by prosecutors as they charged the 22-year-old with capital murder and other crimes after his arrest, Robinson is quoted talking to his partner – whom they described as “transitioning genders” – about having enough of Kirk’s “hatred”. Continue reading...

items.title: Prosecutors to seek death penalty for suspect in Charlie Kirk assassination
items.standfirst: Prosecutors brought a murder charge Tuesday against the man accused of assassinating Charlie Kirk and outlined evidence, including a text message confession to his partner and a note left beforehand saying he had the opportunity to kill one of the nation’s leading conservative voices “and I’m going to take it.” FRANCE 24's Wassim Cornet reports from Los Angeles.
items.content: Prosecutors brought a murder charge Tuesday against the man accused of assassinating Charlie Kirk and outlined evidence, including a text message confession to his partner and a note left beforehand saying he had the opportunity to kill one of the nation’s leading conservative voices “and I’m going to take it.” FRANCE 24's Wassim Cornet reports from Los Angeles.

items.title: Prosecutor to seek death penalty for Kirk shooting suspect
items.standfirst: Utah prosecutors have charged Tyler Robinson, the suspect in the fatal shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk.
items.content: Utah prosecutors have charged Tyler Robinson, the suspect in the fatal shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk.

items.title: Utah files murder charges against Tyler Robinson
items.standfirst: Utah prosecutors charged Tyler Robinson, 22, with the murder of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Officials say they are seeking the death penalty.
items.content: Utah prosecutors charged Tyler Robinson, 22, with the murder of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Officials say they are seeking the death penalty.(Image credit: Utah Governor's Office)

items.title: Charlie Kirk Shooting Suspect Charged as Prosecutor Seeks Death Penalty
items.standfirst: In the indictment, prosecutors claim Tyler Robinson planned Kirk’s killing in advance, citing rooftop surveillance, engraved bullets, and a written note as they seek the death penalty.
items.content: In the indictment, prosecutors claim Tyler Robinson planned Kirk’s killing in advance, citing rooftop surveillance, engraved bullets, and a written note as they seek the death penalty.

items.title: Suspect in Charlie Kirk killing charged with aggravated murder, could face death penalty
items.standfirst: The suspect in the killing of US conservative activist Charlie Kirk was charged with aggravated murder on Tuesday, a count that could carry the death penalty. Prosecutors said 22-year-old Tyler Robinson’s DNA was found on the rifle used to kill Kirk, adding that he told his roommate in text message exchanges that he killed the activist because he'd "had enough of his hatred".
items.content: The suspect in the killing of US conservative activist Charlie Kirk was charged with aggravated murder on Tuesday, a count that could carry the death penalty. Prosecutors said 22-year-old Tyler Robinson’s DNA was found on the rifle used to kill Kirk, adding that he told his roommate in text message exchanges that he killed the activist because he'd "had enough of his hatred".

ai_summary: Tyler Robinson, the suspect, faces aggravated murder charges and the death penalty.
Prosecutors in Utah are seeking the death penalty if Robinson is convicted.
Robinson allegedly ordered his roommate to delete incriminating text messages.
The roommate was also told to remain silent if questioned by police.
The suspect confessed in a hidden note to his roommate, prosecutors allege.

items.title: Trump gets royal welcome in UK as he makes historic second state visit
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump arrived in Britain on Tuesday for a rare second state visit, greeted with a red-carpet welcome as London sought to court the unpredictable leader. “A lot of things here warm my heart. It’s a very special place,” the 79-year-old Republican said with First Lady Melania.

items.title: Donald Trump lands in UK for second state visit as protesters gather in Windsor
items.standfirst: US president arrives on Tuesday ahead of a lavish programme, as Sadiq Khan calls for UK leaders not to shy away from ‘being critical’Donald Trump has landed in the UK ahead of an unprecedented second state visit.The US president and the first lady, Melania Trump, touched down on Tuesday evening at London Stansted onboard Air Force One ahead of a series of events over the next two days, including being hosted by King Charles, military parades and a possible flypast by the Red Arrows alongside British and American F-35 jets. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump announces deadly US strike on another alleged Venezuelan drug boat
items.standfirst: President says three people killed in strike against vessel he said was transporting drugs ‘headed to the US’Donald Trump said on Monday that the United States had carried out a strike on a second Venezuelan boat and killed three alleged terrorists he claimed were transporting drugs, expanding his administration’s war against drug cartels and the scope of lethal military force to stop them.The US president gave few details about the strike, saying in a social media post that the action was on his orders and that it had happened earlier in the morning. The post was accompanied by a video clip showing the boat, which appeared to be stationary, erupting into a fireball. Continue reading...
items.content: President says three people killed in strike against vessel he said was transporting drugs ‘headed to the US’Donald Trump said on Monday that the United States had carried out a strike on a second Venezuelan boat and killed three alleged terrorists he claimed were transporting drugs, expanding his administration’s war against drug cartels and the scope of lethal military force to stop them.The US president gave few details about the strike, saying in a social media post that the action was on his orders and that it had happened earlier in the morning. The post was accompanied by a video clip showing the boat, which appeared to be stationary, erupting into a fireball. Continue reading...

items.title: New York judge tosses terrorism charges against Luigi Mangione, lets murder count stand
items.standfirst: A judge on Tuesday dismissed terrorism charges against Luigi Mangione in New York state's case over the killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, but he kept the state's second-degree murder charges against the Ivy League graduate. FRANCE 24's Caroline Baum reports.

items.title: Spain first of Eurovision ‘big five’ to say it will boycott event if Israel participates
items.standfirst: Head of state broadcaster says it is ‘impossible to look the other way’ over Israel’s actions in GazaSpain has become the latest country to confirm it will not take part in next year’s Eurovision song contest if Israel participates, with the head of its state broadcaster saying “the genocide currently taking place make[s] it impossible for us to look the other way”.The majority decision by RTVE board members makes Spain the first of the “big five” Eurovision countries that contribute the most money to the event to take such action in response to Israel’s offensive in Gaza. items.title: Mbappe scores twice as Real Madrid beat Marseille in Champions League opener
items.standfirst: Kylian Mbappe converted two penalties as Real Madrid fought back to beat Olympique Marseille 2-1 in their Champions League opener on Tuesday. Timothy Weah struck first for the visitors before Mbappe equalised and sealed victory, while Madrid’s Dani Carvajal was sent off for headbutting goalkeeper Geronimo Rulli.
